books.title: Anna Karenina
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.description: The tragic story of aristocrat Anna Karenina's doomed affair with the dashing Count Vronsky and her struggle against the hypocritical conventions of Russian high society.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A dystopian novel about a totalitarian regime that employs mass surveillance, censorship and mind control to subjugate its citizens under Big Brother.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: Elizabeth Bennet navigates manners, upbringing and marriage in aristocratic England, sparring with the proud Mr. Darcy before discovering true love.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: Jay Gatsby's obsessive pursuit of Daisy Buchanan and the corruption of the American Dream set amid roaring-20s wealth and excess.

books.title: Moby-Dick
books.author: Herman Melville
books.description: Ishmael joins the whaling ship Pequod under Captain Ahab, whose monomaniacal quest is to kill the great white whale Moby Dick.

books.title: War and Peace
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.description: An epic panorama of Russian society during the Napoleonic Wars, weaving together the lives of aristocrats, soldiers and peasants.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: Bilbo Baggins is swept into an epic quest to reclaim the dwarve's homeland from the dragon Smaug, discovering courage and cunning along the way.

books.title: Crime and Punishment
books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
books.description: Raskolnikov's theory that certain extraordinary people can transgress moral laws is tested by the guilt and consequences of his own crime.

books.title: Jane Eyre
books.author: Charlotte Brontë
books.description: Orphaned Jane Eyre's resilience and moral conviction lead her from a harsh childhood to a governess position at Thornfield Hall—and to Mr. Rochester.

books.title: The Lord of the Rings
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: Frodo Baggins embarks on a perilous journey to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron, joined by a Fellowship of heroes.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: Scout Finch recalls her childhood in racially divided Alabama and her father Atticus's courageous defense of a black man falsely accused of rape.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: Disaffected teenager Holden Caulfield wanders New York City, grappling with alienation and his desire to protect innocence.

books.title: Brave New World
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.description: In a future society engineered for pleasure and stability, John the Savage challenges the cost of a world without conflict or deep feeling.

books.title: Fahrenheit 451
books.author: Ray Bradbury
books.description: In a society where books are banned and burned by firemen, Guy Montag begins to question his role in censoring history and knowledge.

books.title: Les Misérables
books.author: Victor Hugo
books.description: Ex-convict Jean Valjean seeks redemption under the relentless pursuit of Inspector Javert, set against the backdrop of revolutionary France.

books.title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.description: Dorian Gray remains youthful and beautiful while his portrait ages and reveals the corruption of his soul under hedonistic influences.

books.title: Dracula
books.author: Bram Stoker
books.description: Jonathan Harker's journal and his friends' accounts chronicle the battle against Count Dracula's vampiric terror in Victorian England.

books.title: Wuthering Heights
books.author: Emily Brontë
books.description: Heathcliff's obsessive and destructive love for Catherine Earnshaw tears apart families on the Yorkshire moors across generations.

books.title: Inherit Your Love
books.author: Sally Cook
books.description:
The black sheep wasn't about to turn white

And that was why Laura didn't relish the idea of telling Alex Gillon he was about to become the Earl of Exonby--and the owner of a Gloucestershire estate.

She liked it even less once she'd met handsome, hard-talking Alex--now a successful businessman in New Mexico. He'd fled England years ago, wanting no part of the title or his family's estate. And he definitely didn't plan to return.

The instant electric attraction that sizzled between them brought conflicts--for Laura believed Alex should forget his bitter past and accept his birthright. Even if that meant sacrificing their love.
